00020 class BaseConstructor(object):
00021 
00022     yaml_constructors = {}
00023     yaml_multi_constructors = {}
00024 
00025     def __init__(self):
00026         self.constructed_objects = {}
00027         self.recursive_objects = {}
00028         self.state_generators = []
00029         self.deep_construct = False
00030 
00031     def check_data(self):
00032         # If there are more documents available?
00033         return self.check_node()
00034 
00035     def get_data(self):
00036         # Construct and return the next document.
00037         if self.check_node():
00038             return self.construct_document(self.get_node())
00039 
00040     def construct_document(self, node):
00041         data = self.construct_object(node)
00042         while self.state_generators:
00043             state_generators = self.state_generators
00044             self.state_generators = []
00045             for generator in state_generators:
00046                 for dummy in generator:
00047                     pass
00048         self.constructed_objects = {}
00049         self.recursive_objects = {}
00050         self.deep_construct = False
00051         return data
00052 
00053     def construct_object(self, node, deep=False):
00054         if deep:
00055             old_deep = self.deep_construct
00056             self.deep_construct = True
00057         if node in self.constructed_objects:
00058             return self.constructed_objects[node]
00059         if node in self.recursive_objects:
00060             raise ConstructorError(None, None,
00061                     "found unconstructable recursive node", node.start_mark)
00062         self.recursive_objects[node] = None
00063         constructor = None
00064         state_constructor = None
00065         tag_suffix = None
00066         if node.tag in self.yaml_constructors:
00067             constructor = self.yaml_constructors[node.tag]
00068         else:
00069             for tag_prefix in self.yaml_multi_constructors:
00070                 if node.tag.startswith(tag_prefix):
00071                     tag_suffix = node.tag[len(tag_prefix):]
00072                     constructor = self.yaml_multi_constructors[tag_prefix]
00073                     break
00074             else:
00075                 if None in self.yaml_multi_constructors:
00076                     tag_suffix = node.tag
00077                     constructor = self.yaml_multi_constructors[None]
00078                 elif None in self.yaml_constructors:
00079                     constructor = self.yaml_constructors[None]
00080                 elif isinstance(node, ScalarNode):
00081                     constructor = self.__class__.construct_scalar
00082                 elif isinstance(node, SequenceNode):
00083                     constructor = self.__class__.construct_sequence
00084                 elif isinstance(node, MappingNode):
00085                     constructor = self.__class__.construct_mapping
00086         if tag_suffix is None:
00087             data = constructor(self, node)
00088         else:
00089             data = constructor(self, tag_suffix, node)
00090         if isinstance(data, types.GeneratorType):
00091             generator = data
00092             data = generator.next()
00093             if self.deep_construct:
00094                 for dummy in generator:
00095                     pass
00096             else:
00097                 self.state_generators.append(generator)
00098         self.constructed_objects[node] = data
00099         del self.recursive_objects[node]
00100         if deep:
00101             self.deep_construct = old_deep
00102         return data
00103 
00104     def construct_scalar(self, node):
00105         if not isinstance(node, ScalarNode):
00106             raise ConstructorError(None, None,
00107                     "expected a scalar node, but found %s" % node.id,
00108                     node.start_mark)
00109         return node.value
00110 
00111     def construct_sequence(self, node, deep=False):
00112         if not isinstance(node, SequenceNode):
00113             raise ConstructorError(None, None,
00114                     "expected a sequence node, but found %s" % node.id,
00115                     node.start_mark)
00116         return [self.construct_object(child, deep=deep)
00117                 for child in node.value]
00118 
00119     def construct_mapping(self, node, deep=False):
00120         if not isinstance(node, MappingNode):
00121             raise ConstructorError(None, None,
00122                     "expected a mapping node, but found %s" % node.id,
00123                     node.start_mark)
00124         mapping = {}
00125         for key_node, value_node in node.value:
00126             key = self.construct_object(key_node, deep=deep)
00127             try:
00128                 hash(key)
00129             except TypeError, exc:
00130                 raise ConstructorError("while constructing a mapping", node.start_mark,
00131                         "found unacceptable key (%s)" % exc, key_node.start_mark)
00132             value = self.construct_object(value_node, deep=deep)
00133             mapping[key] = value
00134         return mapping
00135 
00136     def construct_pairs(self, node, deep=False):
00137         if not isinstance(node, MappingNode):
00138             raise ConstructorError(None, None,
00139                     "expected a mapping node, but found %s" % node.id,
00140                     node.start_mark)
00141         pairs = []
00142         for key_node, value_node in node.value:
00143             key = self.construct_object(key_node, deep=deep)
00144             value = self.construct_object(value_node, deep=deep)
00145             pairs.append((key, value))
00146         return pairs
00147 
00148     def add_constructor(cls, tag, constructor):
00149         if not 'yaml_constructors' in cls.__dict__:
00150             cls.yaml_constructors = cls.yaml_constructors.copy()
00151         cls.yaml_constructors[tag] = constructor
00152     add_constructor = classmethod(add_constructor)
00153 
00154     def add_multi_constructor(cls, tag_prefix, multi_constructor):
00155         if not 'yaml_multi_constructors' in cls.__dict__:
00156             cls.yaml_multi_constructors = cls.yaml_multi_constructors.copy()
00157         cls.yaml_multi_constructors[tag_prefix] = multi_constructor
00158     add_multi_constructor = classmethod(add_multi_constructor)

00160 class SafeConstructor(BaseConstructor):

00162     def construct_scalar(self, node):
00163         if isinstance(node, MappingNode):
00164             for key_node, value_node in node.value:
00165                 if key_node.tag == u'tag:yaml.org,2002:value':
00166                     return self.construct_scalar(value_node)
00167         return BaseConstructor.construct_scalar(self, node)
00168 
00169     def flatten_mapping(self, node):
00170         merge = []
00171         index = 0
00172         while index < len(node.value):
00173             key_node, value_node = node.value[index]
00174             if key_node.tag == u'tag:yaml.org,2002:merge':
00175                 del node.value[index]
00176                 if isinstance(value_node, MappingNode):
00177                     self.flatten_mapping(value_node)
00178                     merge.extend(value_node.value)
00179                 elif isinstance(value_node, SequenceNode):
00180                     submerge = []
00181                     for subnode in value_node.value:
00182                         if not isinstance(subnode, MappingNode):
00183                             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a mapping",
00184                                     node.start_mark,
00185                                     "expected a mapping for merging, but found %s"
00186                                     % subnode.id, subnode.start_mark)
00187                         self.flatten_mapping(subnode)
00188                         submerge.append(subnode.value)
00189                     submerge.reverse()
00190                     for value in submerge:
00191                         merge.extend(value)
00192                 else:
00193                     raise ConstructorError("while constructing a mapping", node.start_mark,
00194                             "expected a mapping or list of mappings for merging, but found %s"
00195                             % value_node.id, value_node.start_mark)
00196             elif key_node.tag == u'tag:yaml.org,2002:value':
00197                 key_node.tag = u'tag:yaml.org,2002:str'
00198                 index += 1
00199             else:
00200                 index += 1
00201         if merge:
00202             node.value = merge + node.value
00203 
00204     def construct_mapping(self, node, deep=False):
00205         if isinstance(node, MappingNode):
00206             self.flatten_mapping(node)
00207         return BaseConstructor.construct_mapping(self, node, deep=deep)
00208 
00209     def construct_yaml_null(self, node):
00210         self.construct_scalar(node)
00211         return None

00213     bool_values = {
00214         u'yes':     True,
00215         u'no':      False,
00216         u'true':    True,
00217         u'false':   False,
00218         u'on':      True,
00219         u'off':     False,
00220     }
00221 
00222     def construct_yaml_bool(self, node):
00223         value = self.construct_scalar(node)
00224         return self.bool_values[value.lower()]
00225 
00226     def construct_yaml_int(self, node):
00227         value = str(self.construct_scalar(node))
00228         value = value.replace('_', '')
00229         sign = +1
00230         if value[0] == '-':
00231             sign = -1
00232         if value[0] in '+-':
00233             value = value[1:]
00234         if value == '0':
00235             return 0
00236         elif value.startswith('0b'):
00237             return sign*int(value[2:], 2)
00238         elif value.startswith('0x'):
00239             return sign*int(value[2:], 16)
00240         elif value[0] == '0':
00241             return sign*int(value, 8)
00242         elif ':' in value:
00243             digits = [int(part) for part in value.split(':')]
00244             digits.reverse()
00245             base = 1
00246             value = 0
00247             for digit in digits:
00248                 value += digit*base
00249                 base *= 60
00250             return sign*value
00251         else:
00252             return sign*int(value)
00253 
00254     inf_value = 1e300
00255     while inf_value != inf_value*inf_value:
00256         inf_value *= inf_value
00257     nan_value = -inf_value/inf_value   # Trying to make a quiet NaN (like C99).
00258 
00259     def construct_yaml_float(self, node):
00260         value = str(self.construct_scalar(node))
00261         value = value.replace('_', '').lower()
00262         sign = +1
00263         if value[0] == '-':
00264             sign = -1
00265         if value[0] in '+-':
00266             value = value[1:]
00267         if value == '.inf':
00268             return sign*self.inf_value
00269         elif value == '.nan':
00270             return self.nan_value
00271         elif ':' in value:
00272             digits = [float(part) for part in value.split(':')]
00273             digits.reverse()
00274             base = 1
00275             value = 0.0
00276             for digit in digits:
00277                 value += digit*base
00278                 base *= 60
00279             return sign*value
00280         else:
00281             return sign*float(value)
00282 
00283     def construct_yaml_binary(self, node):
00284         value = self.construct_scalar(node)
00285         try:
00286             return str(value).decode('base64')
00287         except (binascii.Error, UnicodeEncodeError), exc:
00288             raise ConstructorError(None, None,
00289                     "failed to decode base64 data: %s" % exc, node.start_mark) 
00290 
00291     timestamp_regexp = re.compile(
00292             ur'''^(?P<year>[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9])
00293                 -(?P<month>[0-9][0-9]?)
00294                 -(?P<day>[0-9][0-9]?)
00295                 (?:(?:[Tt]|[ \t]+)
00296                 (?P<hour>[0-9][0-9]?)
00297                 :(?P<minute>[0-9][0-9])
00298                 :(?P<second>[0-9][0-9])
00299                 (?:\.(?P<fraction>[0-9]*))?
00300                 (?:[ \t]*(?P<tz>Z|(?P<tz_sign>[-+])(?P<tz_hour>[0-9][0-9]?)
00301                 (?::(?P<tz_minute>[0-9][0-9]))?))?)?$''', re.X)
00302 
00303     def construct_yaml_timestamp(self, node):
00304         value = self.construct_scalar(node)
00305         match = self.timestamp_regexp.match(node.value)
00306         values = match.groupdict()
00307         year = int(values['year'])
00308         month = int(values['month'])
00309         day = int(values['day'])
00310         if not values['hour']:
00311             return datetime.date(year, month, day)
00312         hour = int(values['hour'])
00313         minute = int(values['minute'])
00314         second = int(values['second'])
00315         fraction = 0
00316         if values['fraction']:
00317             fraction = int(values['fraction'][:6].ljust(6, '0'))
00318         delta = None
00319         if values['tz_sign']:
00320             tz_hour = int(values['tz_hour'])
00321             tz_minute = int(values['tz_minute'] or 0)
00322             delta = datetime.timedelta(hours=tz_hour, minutes=tz_minute)
00323             if values['tz_sign'] == '-':
00324                 delta = -delta
00325         data = datetime.datetime(year, month, day, hour, minute, second, fraction)
00326         if delta:
00327             data -= delta
00328         return data
00329 
00330     def construct_yaml_omap(self, node):
00331         # Note: we do not check for duplicate keys, because it's too
00332         # CPU-expensive.
00333         omap = []
00334         yield omap
00335         if not isinstance(node, SequenceNode):
00336             raise ConstructorError("while constructing an ordered map", node.start_mark,
00337                     "expected a sequence, but found %s" % node.id, node.start_mark)
00338         for subnode in node.value:
00339             if not isinstance(subnode, MappingNode):
00340                 raise ConstructorError("while constructing an ordered map", node.start_mark,
00341                         "expected a mapping of length 1, but found %s" % subnode.id,
00342                         subnode.start_mark)
00343             if len(subnode.value) != 1:
00344                 raise ConstructorError("while constructing an ordered map", node.start_mark,
00345                         "expected a single mapping item, but found %d items" % len(subnode.value),
00346                         subnode.start_mark)
00347             key_node, value_node = subnode.value[0]
00348             key = self.construct_object(key_node)
00349             value = self.construct_object(value_node)
00350             omap.append((key, value))
00351 
00352     def construct_yaml_pairs(self, node):
00353         # Note: the same code as `construct_yaml_omap`.
00354         pairs = []
00355         yield pairs
00356         if not isinstance(node, SequenceNode):
00357             raise ConstructorError("while constructing pairs", node.start_mark,
00358                     "expected a sequence, but found %s" % node.id, node.start_mark)
00359         for subnode in node.value:
00360             if not isinstance(subnode, MappingNode):
00361                 raise ConstructorError("while constructing pairs", node.start_mark,
00362                         "expected a mapping of length 1, but found %s" % subnode.id,
00363                         subnode.start_mark)
00364             if len(subnode.value) != 1:
00365                 raise ConstructorError("while constructing pairs", node.start_mark,
00366                         "expected a single mapping item, but found %d items" % len(subnode.value),
00367                         subnode.start_mark)
00368             key_node, value_node = subnode.value[0]
00369             key = self.construct_object(key_node)
00370             value = self.construct_object(value_node)
00371             pairs.append((key, value))
00372 
00373     def construct_yaml_set(self, node):
00374         data = set()
00375         yield data
00376         value = self.construct_mapping(node)
00377         data.update(value)
00378 
00379     def construct_yaml_str(self, node):
00380         value = self.construct_scalar(node)
00381         try:
00382             return value.encode('ascii')
00383         except UnicodeEncodeError:
00384             return value
00385 
00386     def construct_yaml_seq(self, node):
00387         data = []
00388         yield data
00389         data.extend(self.construct_sequence(node))
00390 
00391     def construct_yaml_map(self, node):
00392         data = {}
00393         yield data
00394         value = self.construct_mapping(node)
00395         data.update(value)
00396 
00397     def construct_yaml_object(self, node, cls):
00398         data = cls.__new__(cls)
00399         yield data
00400         if hasattr(data, '__setstate__'):
00401             state = self.construct_mapping(node, deep=True)
00402             data.__setstate__(state)
00403         else:
00404             state = self.construct_mapping(node)
00405             data.__dict__.update(state)
00406 
00407     def construct_undefined(self, node):
00408         raise ConstructorError(None, None,
00409                 "could not determine a constructor for the tag %r" % node.tag.encode('utf-8'),
00410                 node.start_mark)

00463 class Constructor(SafeConstructor):

00465     def construct_python_str(self, node):
00466         return self.construct_scalar(node).encode('utf-8')
00467 
00468     def construct_python_unicode(self, node):
00469         return self.construct_scalar(node)
00470 
00471     def construct_python_long(self, node):
00472         return long(self.construct_yaml_int(node))
00473 
00474     def construct_python_complex(self, node):
00475        return complex(self.construct_scalar(node))
00476 
00477     def construct_python_tuple(self, node):
00478         return tuple(self.construct_sequence(node))

00480     def find_python_module(self, name, mark):
00481         if not name:
00482             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a Python module", mark,
00483                     "expected non-empty name appended to the tag", mark)
00484         try:
00485             __import__(name)
00486         except ImportError, exc:
00487             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a Python module", mark,
00488                     "cannot find module %r (%s)" % (name.encode('utf-8'), exc), mark)
00489         return sys.modules[name]
00490 
00491     def find_python_name(self, name, mark):
00492         if not name:
00493             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a Python object", mark,
00494                     "expected non-empty name appended to the tag", mark)
00495         if u'.' in name:
00496             # Python 2.4 only
00497             #module_name, object_name = name.rsplit('.', 1)
00498             items = name.split('.')
00499             object_name = items.pop()
00500             module_name = '.'.join(items)
00501         else:
00502             module_name = '__builtin__'
00503             object_name = name
00504         try:
00505             __import__(module_name)
00506         except ImportError, exc:
00507             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a Python object", mark,
00508                     "cannot find module %r (%s)" % (module_name.encode('utf-8'), exc), mark)
00509         module = sys.modules[module_name]
00510         if not hasattr(module, object_name):
00511             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a Python object", mark,
00512                     "cannot find %r in the module %r" % (object_name.encode('utf-8'),
00513                         module.__name__), mark)
00514         return getattr(module, object_name)
00515 
00516     def construct_python_name(self, suffix, node):
00517         value = self.construct_scalar(node)
00518         if value:
00519             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a Python name", node.start_mark,
00520                     "expected the empty value, but found %r" % value.encode('utf-8'),
00521                     node.start_mark)
00522         return self.find_python_name(suffix, node.start_mark)
00523 
00524     def construct_python_module(self, suffix, node):
00525         value = self.construct_scalar(node)
00526         if value:
00527             raise ConstructorError("while constructing a Python module", node.start_mark,
00528                     "expected the empty value, but found %r" % value.encode('utf-8'),
00529                     node.start_mark)
00530         return self.find_python_module(suffix, node.start_mark)
00531 
00532     class classobj: pass
00533 
00534     def make_python_instance(self, suffix, node,
00535             args=None, kwds=None, newobj=False):
00536         if not args:
00537             args = []
00538         if not kwds:
00539             kwds = {}
00540         cls = self.find_python_name(suffix, node.start_mark)
00541         if newobj and isinstance(cls, type(self.classobj))  \
00542                 and not args and not kwds:
00543             instance = self.classobj()
00544             instance.__class__ = cls
00545             return instance
00546         elif newobj and isinstance(cls, type):
00547             return cls.__new__(cls, *args, **kwds)
00548         else:
00549             return cls(*args, **kwds)
00550 
00551     def set_python_instance_state(self, instance, state):
00552         if hasattr(instance, '__setstate__'):
00553             instance.__setstate__(state)
00554         else:
00555             slotstate = {}
00556             if isinstance(state, tuple) and len(state) == 2:
00557                 state, slotstate = state
00558             if hasattr(instance, '__dict__'):
00559                 instance.__dict__.update(state)
00560             elif state:
00561                 slotstate.update(state)
00562             for key, value in slotstate.items():
00563                 setattr(object, key, value)
00564 
00565     def construct_python_object(self, suffix, node):
00566         # Format:
00567         #   !!python/object:module.name { ... state ... }
00568         instance = self.make_python_instance(suffix, node, newobj=True)
00569         yield instance
00570         deep = hasattr(instance, '__setstate__')
00571         state = self.construct_mapping(node, deep=deep)
00572         self.set_python_instance_state(instance, state)
00573 
00574     def construct_python_object_apply(self, suffix, node, newobj=False):
00575         # Format:
00576         #   !!python/object/apply       # (or !!python/object/new)
00577         #   args: [ ... arguments ... ]
00578         #   kwds: { ... keywords ... }
00579         #   state: ... state ...
00580         #   listitems: [ ... listitems ... ]
00581         #   dictitems: { ... dictitems ... }
00582         # or short format:
00583         #   !!python/object/apply [ ... arguments ... ]
00584         # The difference between !!python/object/apply and !!python/object/new
00585         # is how an object is created, check make_python_instance for details.
00586         if isinstance(node, SequenceNode):
00587             args = self.construct_sequence(node, deep=True)
00588             kwds = {}
00589             state = {}
00590             listitems = []
00591             dictitems = {}
00592         else:
00593             value = self.construct_mapping(node, deep=True)
00594             args = value.get('args', [])
00595             kwds = value.get('kwds', {})
00596             state = value.get('state', {})
00597             listitems = value.get('listitems', [])
00598             dictitems = value.get('dictitems', {})
00599         instance = self.make_python_instance(suffix, node, args, kwds, newobj)
00600         if state:
00601             self.set_python_instance_state(instance, state)
00602         if listitems:
00603             instance.extend(listitems)
00604         if dictitems:
00605             for key in dictitems:
00606                 instance[key] = dictitems[key]
00607         return instance
00608 
00609     def construct_python_object_new(self, suffix, node):
00610         return self.construct_python_object_apply(suffix, node, newobj=True)
00611
